name: action-buttons
description: Add customizable buttons to the status bar to execute actions or tasks

createButton.markdownDescription:
Determines if the action button is created

Change this to `false` for dropdown items

saveAll.markdownDescription: Save all open files before execute command

command.markdownDescription:
Command to execute when action is activated.

If `useVsCodeApi` is `true`, this is the VS Code command to execute. Otherwise, this specifies the command to execute in the terminal

tooltip.markdownDescription: Tooltip text to display when hovering over the button

color.markdownDescription: Specifies the action button text color

cwd.markdownDescription:
Start directory when executing terminal command

Only valid when `useVsCodeApi` is `false`

singleInstance.markdownDescription:
Reopen associated terminal each time this action is activated

Only valid when `useVsCodeApi` is `false`

focus.markdownDescription:
Focus the terminal after executing the command.

Only valid when `useVsCodeApi` is `false`

useVsCodeApi.markdownDescription: Specifies whether to execute a VS Code command or terminal command

args.markdownDescription:
List of arguments passed to VS Code command

Only valid when `useVsCodeApi` is `true`

commands.markdownDescription: A list with the id or name for the commands to display in the dropdown

color.markdownDescription: Specifies the action button text color

ignoreFocusOut.markdownDescription: Determines if the dropdown should stay open even when loosing dropdown focus.

tooltip.markdownDescription: Tooltip text to display when hovering over the button

dropdowns.markdownDescription: Specifies commands that can be accessed with a quick-select

defaultColor.markdownDescription: Default color to use for action button text

reloadButton.markdownDescription: Reload button text. If `null`, button is disabled

loadNpmCommands.markdownDescription: Specifies whether to automatically generate buttons from npm commands listed in `package.json`
